abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Highway Sector
            Project for the Ivory Coast was satisfactory. The project
            achieved its major objectives, its impact on institutional
            development was substantial, sustainability is likely, and
            the performance of both the Bank and Borrower was
            satisfactory. Two main lessons can be learned from this
            project. First, although the training program for road
            maintenance staff fell short of target, it still has great
            potential for increasing road maintenance effectiveness and
            should be continued under follow-up projects. Second, in the
            future, responsibility for overall project progress
            reporting and disbursement coordination should be given to
            only one of the project executing agencies.

docna.cdata!:
Ivory Coast - Highway Sector Project : Loan
            1914 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Ivory Coast - Highway Sector
            Project : Loan 1914 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The First Highway Sector Loan Project
            will assist the Government in its policy of restrained
            investments, improved sector planning and coordination and
            improved road maintenance operations, by financing part of
            the 1981-83 highway investment program and relevant
            technical assistance and training. Project benefits would
            accrue to the economy at large in the form of savings in
            vehicle operating costs; institutional strengthening would
            also be a major benefit. The project does not face special risks.
